De lo mejor de lo mejor. Comprelo sin titubear. AdemÃ¡s, el workshop te ofrece un juego practicamente eterno.

I love these games with all my heart. They're so fun an charming. The gameplay is great, and completing the puzzles really gave me a true sense of pride and acomplishment. (Pun intended) Also, they are really short, so the best thing you could do is buy them and play them all in 1 day or 2. These games deserve to be played.

The sequel the surpasses the original in almost everyway.
Pros
- Great, funny writing full of dark humor
- Amazing music
- Great new additions to mix up puzzles
- Puzzles are mind bending
- Ability to create your own test champers.
- Wheatley is a great new character.
-J.K Simmons voices Cave Johnson. Enough said.
Cons
Can't think of anything

I haven't tried the co op yet, but this game is amazing with the single player.

Builds on the fantastic original in almost every way, yet the difficulty of the puzzles are dulled down
8/10 brilliant
In all honesty, this is the greatest game I have ever played. It is simply a masterpiece.

This game is more of Portal, which was already a great game in which one of the really only complaints with it was a lack of content. 

Portal 2, is more content for portal, with a more lengthy and interesting story, along with new mechanics. This is a sequel done right. 

If you loved Portal, you're going to love Portal 2, simply. This game offers the same interesting physics puzzles present in the first game, and provides even more than the first game does in terms of more difficulty and interesting mechanics.

Add to that a community map creation tool and Co-op, and this game is simply amazing. Co-op or single player, this is one of the best puzzle games ever created, play it now, you won't be disappointed.
kruto
ATRAVESSEI O PORTAL 1 E FUI PARA O PORTAL 2 :D
Muy interesante, lo recomiendo

Little irony in the fact that the best ever Xbox 360 console game (ok in my opinion) comes fromt he biggest digital pc game supplier. 

If you haven't experience this game and Gladdos (see my review of Portal 1), buy this, play this, you will not be dissapointed. Not many time a sequel outshines the original. Yes, there is a slow bit or two in the middle, and yes you are going to get stuck somewhere. But still, this is as close to perfection that a puzzle game will get. 

This was my second time finishing the game, and it is still as good as all the reviews tell you. A great game will alway be fun. Nothing more I can add. Superb. A modern masterpiece. Worthy of a hall of fame nomination for gaming. Now I know the developers don't like to count to 3, lunacy, but I will quietly enjoy a piece of cake and hope and dream :) 10/10

ĞĞµ Ñ‚Ğ°ĞºĞ°Ñ Ğ°Ñ‚Ğ¼Ğ¾ÑÑ„ĞµÑ€Ğ½Ğ°Ñ, ĞºĞ°Ğº Ğ¿ĞµÑ€Ğ²Ğ°Ñ Ñ‡Ğ°ÑÑ‚ÑŒ, Ğ½Ğ¾ Ñ Ğ·Ğ°Ñ…Ğ²Ğ°Ñ‚Ñ‹Ğ²Ğ°ÑÑ‰Ğ¸Ğ¼ ÑÑĞ¶ĞµÑ‚Ğ¾Ğ¼ Ğ¸ Ğ¼ÑƒĞ»ÑŒÑ‚Ğ¸Ğ¿Ğ»ĞµĞµÑ€Ğ¾Ğ¼.

The first Portal was good, but they took everything from the first one and made it so much better! P2 is the perfect level of difficulty, not too hard, not too easy, and all puzzles could be solved if you just spent long enough tinkering with them. Just when I was at my wits end with a puzzle, a lightbulb would go off and the solution was clear! So much more story this time around and they really amped up the comedy, I laughed out loud quite a few times. And the graphics and huge detailed areas, they really outdid themselves! And if you're one of those people who puts off playing a sequel because they didn't play the first one and don't want to play this first one...just read a quick synopsis of P1 and jump right into this one, very easy to follow if you just know the main story points of the first one!
